intro: Krigia wrightii, commonly known as the plains morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Krigia wrightii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
